page.title: 02VILLAGES: DANE END & AREA
page.content: {DANE END}is the most important village in the area. There are 738 inhabitants. It has a church, a school, a public house. a general store and Post Office and a garage. {SACOMBE}is the second largest village or hamlet with a population of about 100. It has a church but there is no shop. It had a public house but this was closed some time ago but there are plans to open this building as a restaurant. The school was closed in the 1930's and the children are taken by taxi to Little Munden School. {DANE END}and{SACOMBE}lie in a valley. The hamlets of{POTTERS GREEN, ROWNEY {PRIORY}and{SACOMBE GREEN}nestle on the hillsides. The fields around the villages contain barley, wheat, rape, oats, maize and grass for silage. The Dane End tributary often overflows its banks.
